publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-304 Susan Deacon: Banking Facilities at Post Officesâ€”That the Parliament believes that all those who currently receive pension payments, tax credit and benefits through the Post Office should be able to continue to do so; considers that the Communications Workers Union "Banking on You" campaign highlights the need to better publicise the banking facilities that Post Offices now offer; further considers that access to the Post Office Card Account should be made easier, and believes that all major banks including HSBC, HBOS, Royal Bank of Scotland and Natwest should be urged to sign up to universal banking by making all current accounts available at Post Offices. Supported by: Mark Ballard*
S2M-304 Banking Facilities at Post Offices (lodged on 5 September 2003) Tommy Sheridan*, Rosie Kane*, Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-304 Banking Facilities at Post Offices (lodged on 5 September 2003) Carolyn Leckie*, John Swinburne*, Marlyn Glen*
S2M-304 Banking Facilities at Post Offices (lodged on 5 September 2003) Frances Curran*, Iain Smith*, Bill Butler*

S2M-304 Banking Facilities at Post Offices (lodged on 5 September 2003) Mary Scanlon*, Eleanor Scott*, Brian Adam*, Richard Lochhead*, David Mundell*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Phil Gallie*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Robert Brown*, Cathie Craigie*, Jackie Baillie*, Ms Sandra White*, Trish Godman*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Mike Pringle*, Mrs Margaret Smith*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Margaret Mitchell*, Shona Robison*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Stewart Stevenson*, Mike Watson*, Colin Fox*, Maureen Macmillan*, Helen Eadie*, Margo MacDonald*, John Scott*, Elaine Smith*

S2M-304 Banking Facilities at Post Offices (lodged on 5 September 2003) Cathy Peattie*, Robin Harper*, Nora Radcliffe*, Shiona Baird*, Dr Jean Turner*, Chris Ballance*, Kate Maclean*, Mr David Davidson*
S2M-304 Banking Facilities at Post Offices (lodged on 5 September 2003) Mr Mark Ruskell*, Donald Gorrie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-304 Banking Facilities at Post Offices (lodged on 5 September 2003) Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-304 Banking Facilities at Post Offices (lodged on 5 September 2003) Linda Fabiani*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Scott Barrie*, Karen Whitefield*

S2M-304*#* Susan Deacon: Banking Facilities at Post Offices-That the Parliament believes that all those who currently receive pension payments, tax credit and benefits through the Post Office should be able to continue to do so; considers that the Communications Workers Union "Banking on You" campaign highlights the need to better publicise the banking facilities that Post Offices now offer; further considers that access to the Post Office Card Account should be made easier, and believes that all major banks including HSBC, HBOS, Royal Bank of Scotland and Natwest should be urged to sign up to universal banking by making all current accounts available at Post Offices. Supported by: Mark Ballard, Tommy Sheridan, Rosie Kane, Fiona Hyslop, Carolyn Leckie, John Swinburne, Marlyn Glen, Frances Curran, Iain Smith, Bill Butler, Mary Scanlon, Eleanor Scott, Brian Adam, Richard Lochhead, David Mundell, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Phil Gallie, Roseanna Cunningham, Dr Elaine Murray, Robert Brown, Cathie Craigie, Jackie Baillie, Ms Sandra White, Trish Godman, Mr Keith Raffan, Mike Pringle, Mrs Margaret Smith, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Pauline McNeill, Mr Bruce McFee, Margaret Mitchell, Shona Robison, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Stewart Stevenson, Mike Watson, Colin Fox, Maureen Macmillan, Helen Eadie, Margo MacDonald, John Scott, Elaine Smith, Cathy Peattie, Robin Harper, Nora Radcliffe, Shiona Baird, Dr Jean Turner, Chris Ballance, Kate Maclean, Mr David Davidson, Mr Mark Ruskell, Donald Gorrie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Mr Brian Monteith, Linda Fabiani, Marilyn Livingstone, Scott Barrie, Karen Whitefield, Bristow Muldoon*
S2M-304# Banking Facilities at Post Offices (lodged on 5 September 2003) Christine Grahame*
S2M-304# Banking Facilities at Post Offices (lodged on 5 September 2003) Dennis Canavan*, Rhona Brankin*
